name: Detrital Processing (CPOM retention / shredders)
functionStatement: Organic matter is captured and broken down, fueling food webs, balancing production/ respiration, moderating pH/ redox, and supplying nutrients.
descriptionMarkdown:
Leaf litter/coarse organic matter are visibly retained, supporting detrital processes per local references.
Quick checks show these invertebrates, indicating healthy detrital processing (if typical).
howToMeasureMarkdown:
Count leaf packs and small debris dams, or infer retention from wood presence and low-velocity habitat during a field visit.
Conduct a rapid kick sample and note presence of shredder taxa where a CPOM pathway is expected.

inputs.label: Detrital Processing (CPOM retention / shredders)
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Abundant CPOM retention with stable leaf packs typical for the system. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Some retention but partially flushed out. (Suggested index range 0.50-0.69)

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Sparse organic matter and limited retention. (Suggested index range 0.30-0.49)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Essentially no retained organic matter, or severe overload causing anoxia risk. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)

references: planform complexity from imagery as supporting context.
State biomonitoring portals and/or EPA Water Quality Portal biological results (where available).
